employer: Research Institute for Medical & Health Sciences (RIMHS)
description:
Research Group: Microbiota
Research Center: Research Institute for Medical & Health Sciences

The selected IAESTE intern will participate in ongoing research within the Microbiota Research Group, focusing on the interactions between dietary components, probiotics/prebiotics, and host immune responses.

Key Responsibilities:-

Mammalian Cell Culture Work:
Perform in-vitro experiments using mammalian cell lines to evaluate cellular responses to prebiotic and probiotic treatments. Tasks include cell maintenance, viability assays, treatment administration, and downstream molecular analyses.
In Vivo Experimental Support:
Assist in the development and handling of a mouse model of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Duties may include animal monitoring, oral/rectal administration of treatments, tissue harvesting (colon, spleen, lymph nodes), and blood collection under supervision and ethical guidelines.
Microbiology & Immunology Laboratory Techniques: 
Conduct experiments involving microbial culture, identification, and quantification; immune cell isolation; flow cytometryâ€“based phenotyping; cytokine assays; and molecular biology methods such as PCR, qPCR, and protein analysis.
Contribution to Ongoing Research Projects:
The internship will form part of a major research project investigating microbiotaâ€“immune interactions, providing exposure to cutting-edge methodologies in microbiome science, hostâ€“microbe immunology, and metabolic profiling.

Learning Outcomes:
The intern will gain hands-on experience in advanced laboratory techniques, animal model handling, experimental design, data analysis, and interdisciplinary research practices within microbiology, immunology, and molecular biology.
other_requirements: BSc or MSc or PhD in Molecular Biology, Immunology, Microbiology or similar areas
additional_Info:
The start date is fixed at either 1-Sep-26 or 1-Oct-26.
Please read the attached document and follow the instructions rigorously.

description:
Research Group: OpenUAE Research and Development Group
Research Center: Cybersecurity and Data Analytics

The intern will focus on developing and applying large language models (LLMs) and agentic AI systems for climate resilience, environmental monitoring, and flood risk intelligence. The work includes extracting knowledge from multimodal environmental data sources, such as sensor feeds, satellite maps, and hydrological reports, and developing AI-supported decision pipelines that enhance preparedness and response in climate-sensitive regions. The intern will be part of a collaborative research team but will also be responsible for dedicated individual tasks. The intern will collaborate with the research team while handling defined independent tasks to advance AI-enabled environmental resilience technologies.

- The intern shall submit weekly progress reports for performance evaluation purposes.
- The intern shall fulfill all their hours inside the lab.
- Previous experience in object detection and recognition is required.

Intern required:
- Fast learner, proactive, enthusiastic about sustainability-focused research, and motivated to innovate.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with emphasis on resilience planning and climateâ€impact solutions.
- Excellent written and verbal communication abilities for coordination with multidisciplinary teams (engineering, climate science, policy).
- Demonstrated responsibility, adaptability, and interest in long-term resilience goals and environmental impact.
- Ability to manage research timelines, maintain data integrity, and contribute effectively in collaborative environments.
- Integrate AI models with climate data platforms & early-warning analytics tools: 
- Multimodal AI (text, image ,sensor data) for environmental assessment
- Has good academic writing experience.
-Ability to utilize LLMs and agentic AI to advance climate resilience, environmental monitoring, and flood preparedness.
additional_Info:
The start date is fixed at either 1-Sep-26 or 1-Oct-26.
Please read the attached document and follow the instructions rigorously.

student_status_requirements: Required during the whole period of the internship
description:
1. Support for Sample Collection and Data Integrity
The intern will be expected to support the procedures used to generate samples for ongoing experiments.
Protocol Support: Assisting with the final days of the Social Instability Stress (SIS) protocol and ensuring animals are correctly grouped.

Estrous Cycle Determination: For the female mice, the intern will be trained to collect vaginal samples at the time of euthanasia and assist in analyzing the cell types under a microscope to determine the phase of the estrous cycle (proestrus, estrus, metestrus, diestrus).

2. Brain Tissue Processing and Immunofluorescence 
The intern will be trained to perform the complete immunofluorescence protocol.

Brain Slicing: Assisting with, or learning to, section the frozen mouse brains into 35 Î¼m coronal slices using a cryostat. This involves correctly identifying the target regions (mPFC, amygdala, hippocampus) during slicing.

Staining Protocol: Performing the multi-step staining process, which includes:
-Washing the tissue slices in PBS.
-Incubating slices in a blocking solution (containing goat serum and Triton X-100) to prevent non-specific antibody binding.
-Performing the 24-hour incubation with primary antibodies, specifically Anti-Î”FosB (EPR15905) and Anti-5HT2A (ASR-033-GP200UL).
-Washing and incubating the slices with the fluorescent secondary antibodies (Alexa Fluor 488 and Alexa-Fluor 568).

Mounting: Carefully mounting the delicate, stained brain slices onto silanized glass slides and applying the Fluoroshield Mounting Medium + DAPI to stain cell nuclei and preserve the fluorescent signal.

3. Microscopy and Data Analysis
This is the core activity, identifying the pattern of activation.

Image Capture: Assisting in the capture of high-resolution fluorescent images from the prepared slides using the Axio Imager 2 microscope.

Data Quantification: The intern will be trained to use the ImageJ software to quantify the results. This is a critical task and involves:

- Defining the regions of interest (mPFC, amygdala, hippocampus) in the digital images.
- Applying the "Corrected total cell fluorescence" (CTCF) technique to measure the intensity of the Î”FosB and 5HT2A signals.
- Organizing the resulting numerical data for statistical analysis.

field: Material Engineering and Sciences, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Robotics and Automation
description:
This research position focuses on the experimental evaluation of the effect of annealing temperature and time on the mechanical properties of composite materials fabricated through Fused Deposition Modeling (FDM).

Additive manufacturing of composite materials has significant potential in engineering applications; however, post-processing conditions such as thermal treatments play a critical role in defining final material performance. This project contributes to applied research in materials science and advanced manufacturing, combining fabrication, thermal processing, and mechanical characterization.

The selected student will engage in the full experimental workflow, including:
- Fabrication of composite material specimens using 3D printing
- Application of annealing heat treatments at different temperatures and durations
- Mechanical testing, including tensile and flexural tests
- Microstructural characterization using optical microscopy (OM) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM)
- Data processing and analysis of experimental results
other_requirements: - Basic understanding of heat treatments, particularly annealing
additional_Info:
As a student you will be enrolled at Universidad San Francisco de Quito , therefore your legal status in Ecuador will be as a student doing a cultural exchange program , in order to complete your studies. Despite of the fact that Ecuador allows almost every country to come as a tourist, you must to request an extension of permanence in Ecuador if you stay longer than 90 days. It is mandatory to apply a visa before coming to Ecuador for the following countries: Afganistan, Angola, Bangladesh, Republic of Cameroon, Cuba, Egypt, Eritrea, Etiopia, Gambia, Ghana, Guinera, Haiti, Ivory Coast,  India, Irak, Kenia, Libia, Nepal, Nigeria, PakistÃ¡n, Philippines,  Democratic Republic of the Congo, North Korea, Senegal, Siria, Somalia, Sri Lanka, Venezuela, Vietnam, Yemen. 
Students must have Health Insurance. Accommodation will be arranged by IAESTE ECUADOR in the case that student will want our help. We will pick you up from the airport and take you to your Guest House.

field: Computer Science / Informatics, Industrial Engineering / System Engineering, Microbiology
description:
This research position explores the integration of Digital Twins and Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance interactive learning in logistics and operations, using the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) as a case study.

The project sits at the intersection of artificial intelligence, optimization, and educational technologies, aiming to design and evaluate intelligent systems that support learning and decision-making in complex operational problems. Students will work on cutting-edge applications of LLMs in logistics-oriented digital environments.

The selected student will:
- Implement and evaluate LLM-based infrastructures applied to logistics and operations
- Integrate digital twin models with AI-driven interactive systems
- Develop and test learning-oriented solutions using the TSP as a reference problem
- Analyze system performance and learning outcomes

description:
Battery Engineer- Internship

Shaping the Future of Automotive Engineering
Applus+ IDIADA is a global leader in automotive engineering, offering a dynamic and rewarding career opportunity for professionals passionate about shaping the future of mobility. As a TOP Employer certified company with over 3400 professionals in 24 countries, we provide a diverse and inclusive work environment that fosters innovation and growth with colleagues from over 57 nationalities contributing to a safer, more efficient, and sustainable vehicles.

Join a company that has a deep commitment to sustainability and push yourself to reach your full potential in a dynamic and challenging setting that values innovation and expertise.

Come & join us on the road to success.  

Job Description

Responsibilities

- You will help organize testing samples according to laboratory standards.
- You will gain hands-on experience in setting up and configuring testing equipment correctly under supervision.
- You will learn and apply standarized testing procedures, ensuring compliance with established protocols and quality standards.
- You will support senior staff in conducting tests, configuring testing equipments executing a variety of tests and gaining practical laboratory experience.
- You will collect experimental data systematically and analyze results using appropiate tools and methodologies.
- You will work on creating professional reports that address customer requirements and communicate testing findings effectively.
- You will participate in internal meetings, email communications, phone calls and video conferences to stay informed and contribute to team discussions.

Qualifications
Education and Experience:
-	Currently pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Chemistry or Chemical Engineering
-	Ideally final-year students
-	Only current students will be considered

Technical Skills:
-	Foundational knowledge or willing to learn about electric/hybrid vehicle technologies, energy systems charging systems.
. MATLAB/Simulink knowledge will be an asset.

Language Requirements:
-	Native German and Fluent English


Professional Attributes:
-	Demonstrated interest in technology and innovation in the automotive sector
-	Eagerness to learn about the automotive industry
-	Customer-focused mindset with attention to service excellence
-	Analytical mindset with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving
-	Strong attention to detail and analytical capabilities


Applus IDIADA is committed to equality, diversity and inclusion. We don't put limits on you, so don't put limits on yourself either. There is a place for everyone.
other_requirements:
Interview required.

Important:
-Only candidates with active enrollment in a bachelor's or master's program at the start of the internship will be considered.
-In line with our commitment to gender parity and increasing female representation, we will prioritize female applicants.

German or Austrian passport holders

description:
We're seeking an ambitious Business Development Intern to join our Sales Team. This internship is designed for individuals eager to break into the world of technology sales and gain real-world experience working with cutting-edge products and innovative solutions. As a Business Development Intern, you'll work closely with our Account Management and Sales teams to identify new business opportunities, engage prospective clients, and help build meaningful customer relationships. Youâ€™ll learn the core foundations of B2B Comentado [ES1]: Business-to-Business (B2B) technology sales while using industry-standard tools and platforms.
What Youâ€™ll Do:
- Conduct outbound/inbound outreach to prospective clients via phone, email, and social media.
- Qualify leads and help identify sales opportunities to support the Sales and Account Management teams.
- Leverage CRM tools like Hubspot to manage prospects and client information accurately.
- Assist in presenting our tech products/services by understanding client challenges and aligning solutions.
- Participate in sales strategy meetings and learn how to navigate complex sales cycles.
- Collaborate across departments to help deliver compelling sales pitches and proposals.

What Youâ€™ll Need:
- Strong interest in technology, SaaS products, or B2B sales.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and a willingness to learn.
- Some familiarity with CRM platforms (HubSpot is a plus).
- Self-starter mentality with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
- Natural problem-solver with a proactive and high-energy attitude.
- Comfortable making outbound calls and engaging with clients.

What Youâ€™ll Gain:
- Hands-on experience in technology sales and B2B client development
- Mentorship from experienced tech sales professionals
- Exposure to CRM systems and industry sales tools
- Networking opportunities within the tech industry
- A potential path to a full-time role in tech sales or account management

Who You Are
We take our guiding values seriously. You should be someone who will:
- build trust. You always act in a customerâ€™s best interest and do what you say you will do.
- take action. You respond quickly to customers and seek excellence in everything you do.
. think BIG. You have an eye to the future and bring expertise and creativity into every interaction.
- make it easy. You find ways to solve problems and bring clarity to complex challenges.
- win together. You are inclusive and collaborate to delight the customer and deliver success together.

employer: Iran University of Science and Technology (IUST)
description:
Industry 5.0 is the emerging trend of manufacturing technologies towards smart factories. The industrial internet of things (IIoT) plays a primordial role to achieve the objectives of Industry 5.0, by enabling the cyber-physical production systems (CPPS) to communicate and cooperate with each other and with humans both internally and across the participants of the supply chain. 
In an IIoT environment, a huge amount of data is continuously generated by sensors. The generated data should be then analyzed by the controller to generate valuable information for factory operations and driving the access and control of CPPS devices through actuators. The data in IIoT are usually critical in both mission and time, for which even a minor undesired delay may result in catastrophic situation. In addition to the latency constraint of IIoT applications, the Industry 5.0 should face the limitation of network
devices in terms of energy, especially in harsh or hazardous industrial scenarios, such as the production industry and mining, where it may not be possible to connect devices to a power source or the power supply is self-powered. Consequently, it is crucial to develop an adequate data management scheme, considering the strict requirements of industrial applications.
The traditional centralized data management in IIoT is inappropriate for real applications because of its communication overhead and inability to cope with strict delay requirements of IIoT applications and energy constraints of IIoT networks. Therefore, recent researches focus on developing a distributed data management layer for IIoT. 
However, such a distributed data management layer is susceptible to attacks targeting the confidentiality and integrity of data cached on distributed nodes. In this context, the objective of this training is to propose a blockchain-based distributed data management layer for IIoT that guarantees the integrity and confidentiality of data cached in the distributed management layer.

description:
The Laboratory Technician Intern will assist in the preparation, organization, and maintenance of laboratory facilities to support teaching and research activities within the University. Working under the supervision of senior laboratory staff and academic members, the intern will gain hands-on experience in laboratory management, experiment setup, equipment handling, and safety compliance.

Key Responsibilities:

Preparation and Setup of Practical Sessions

Prepare reagents, specimens, and equipment required for laboratory practicals.

Set up experiments and demonstrations before class sessions, ensuring all materials are available and functioning properly.

Support academic staff in planning and organizing laboratory schedules.

Assistance During Laboratory Sessions

Provide technical support to students during practical classes.

Guide students on proper equipment use, laboratory techniques, and safety procedures.

Troubleshoot minor equipment or experimental issues as they arise.

Safety and Compliance

Enforce laboratory safety standards and procedures.

Maintain up-to-date Safety Data Sheets (SDS) and chemical inventories.

Conduct routine inspections, risk assessments, and ensure proper disposal of hazardous materials in line with regulations.

Equipment and Inventory Management

Monitor and manage stock levels of chemicals, glassware, and consumables.

Maintain, clean, and calibrate laboratory instruments and apparatus regularly.

Keep detailed maintenance and calibration logs for reference and accountability.

Support for Research and Student Projects

Assist final-year students and staff with project experiments and data collection.

Participate in developing and improving laboratory experiments and teaching aids.

Document experimental setups, procedures, and outcomes for reproducibility.

Administrative and Record-Keeping Duties

Maintain accurate records of laboratory usage, maintenance activities, and student attendance.

Liaise with academic staff to ensure smooth coordination of lab sessions and requirements.

Expected Learning Outcomes:

By the end of the internship, the intern will have gained practical experience in laboratory operations, safety management, and experimental procedures. The role provides a foundation in technical problem-solving, organization, and scientific precision, preparing the intern for future roles in laboratory management, research assistance, or scientific education.

description:
Back-end Developer - Universet Learning Platform
Join the Award-Winning Universet Team

Universet is a gamified learning platform that transforms computer science education into an engaging adventure. Students progress through quests, earn achievements, compete on leaderboards, and collaborate in guilds - all while mastering programming concepts. The platform has achieved remarkable results: zero dropout rates among active users, and students who participate consistently perform significantly better on exams than those who don't.
Over 1,000 students have used Universet, with peaks of 300 concurrent users during active periods. All code and logs are stored on the University of Oslo's infrastructure, giving us access to high-end load balancing and robust scaling possibilities as we continue to grow.
Our work has been recognized with multiple prestigious awards in 2024 and 2025, including the University of Oslo's Teaching Prize 2024. What started as an innovative approach to teaching introductory computer science is now being prepared for rollout across multiple disciplines, potentially transforming how thousands of students learn.
This spring, we're in full-scale development with over 10 dedicated developers building the next generation of the platform. Many of our current developers were themselves students who used Universet and loved it so much they wanted to contribute to its evolution. We're now looking for talented international students to join us this summer and be part of this exciting expansion. You'll work alongside a highly competent steering team with decades of combined experience in software development, pedagogy, and technology - people who are passionate about using technology to make education better.

About the Position
As a back-end developer, you'll work on the core infrastructure of a platform used by hundreds of computer science students. You'll be mentored by a steering team with decades of combined experience in software development, pedagogy, and technology.
additional_Info:
Please specify your availability within this period in your application - we aim to coordinate all international team members to work simultaneously
We will confirm final dates after reviewing applications


This job requires that you are a citizen of the European Economic Area (EEA) or CH.

field: Industrial Engineering / System Engineering, Mechanical Engineering
description:
This work is experimental intensive to develop polymer composites suitable for high mechanical and thermal loads. The work involves both thermoplastics
and thermosets. The development with thermoplastics is based on twin screw extrusion followed by compression molding. However, the work with
thermosets is based on vacuum assisted resin transfer molding. For both polymer composites, the material preparation is followed by testing (tensile test,
compression test, harness test, DSC, TGA, .. etc). The results are to be evaluated/analyzed in weekly basis to decide the next step for the material
development. By the end of the training, the student is expected to gain a good knowledge in polymers processing and testing.
additional_Info: Dr. Mahmood Al-Kindi

employer: Institute of Material Science, Division of Advanced Materials and Composites - TUL
field: Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, Material Engineering and Sciences
student_status_requirements: required during the whole internship period
description: The student will work on the project of synthesizing graphene quantum dots for new solutions in the field of transparent photovoltaics and sensors. (Nobel Prize in 2023 for the synthesis and exploration of quantum dots awarded to Moungi G. Bawendi, Louis E. Brus, and Aleksey Yekimovdo). The research team, of which the intern will be a member, is involved in creating nanometric structures for use in various technologies, including renewable energy, medicine, spintronics, optoelectronics, and other modern branches of industry.
other_requirements: Student form Nanotechnology  or Microelectronics is also warmly welcome.

field: Computer Science / Informatics, Computer Software/Hardware Engineering, Cybersecurity
description:
The intern will join GridsAppsâ€™ development team and follow a structured technical track designed to build practical full-stack development skills. All interns begin with the core web fundamentals: HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap 5, Tailwind CSS, JavaScript, and introductory Node.js. Early tasks include creating responsive layouts, translating design mockups into functional interfaces, implementing reusable UI components, and writing simple client-side scripts to handle user interactions.

Interns pursuing front-end development will then advance to React.js and Next.js. Their work will involve designing functional components, managing state with hooks, integrating external APIs, optimizing rendering performance, and contributing to small interactive applications that reflect real industry workflows.

Interns selecting a back-end path will specialize in one of three focus areas. Those working with C# and ASP.NET Core will implement REST APIs, handle routing, work with Entity Framework, and manage authentication logic. Those choosing Python will focus on server-side logic, data handling, and basic automation tasks. Interns selecting PHP with Laravel will work on MVC architecture, routing, controllers, Blade templates, and database migrations.

The objectives of the internship are to give each intern hands-on experience with modern development practices, strengthen their understanding of full-stack workflows, and improve their ability to work within a professional development environment. The program aims to enhance technical and problem-solving skills, introduce interns to version control and collaborative coding, and prepare them for real software development roles by assigning tasks that contribute to ongoing GridsApps projects.
additional_Info: The environment is fully remote with structured mentorship, weekly check-ins, and access to collaborative tools. The aim is to give students hands-on experience with modern full-stack practices while contributing to real components used in GridsAppsâ€™ development pipeline.

employer: Muhimbili University of Health and Allied Sciences
student_status_requirements: Interns are required to be onsite during the whole duration of the internship
description: The Microbiology Internship at the Muhimbili University of Health and Allied Sciences (MUHAS) is designed to provide students with comprehensive exposure to laboratory practices, research methodologies, and academic engagement in the field of microbiology. Interns will actively participate in routine microbiological analyses, including culturing, staining, and identification of microorganisms, while assisting faculty and researchers in projects related to medical microbiology, infectious diseases, and public health. They will conduct experiments under supervision, ensuring strict adherence to biosafety and aseptic techniques, and contribute to sample collection, preparation, and data recording for clinical and environmental studies. Additional responsibilities include maintaining laboratory equipment, preparing reagents, and ensuring proper waste disposal in compliance with institutional safety standards. Interns will also support literature reviews, data entry, and preliminary analysis for research publications, while collaborating with peers and supervisors to present findings in seminars, workshops, or departmental meetings. The internship emphasizes professional growth through hands-on technical training, analytical problem-solving, and effective communication, preparing interns to understand the role of microbiology in diagnostics, infection control, and public health policy. Supervision will be provided by faculty and laboratory staff, with performance evaluated on technical competence, adherence to safety protocols, teamwork, and contribution to research activities. Interns are expected to commit to regular laboratory hours over the course of one academic semester, demonstrate reliability, initiative, and uphold the values of integrity, responsibility, and dedication to advancing knowledge. Respect for diversity, collaboration, and excellence is essential, as interns embody the universityâ€™s mission to inspire innovation, uphold ethical standards, and strengthen the link between microbiological science and healthcare practice.
additional_Info:
1. Visa shall be applied online via https://visa.immigration.go.tz/start. The IAESTE Tanzania will provide an introductory letter to the applicant. 

2. Special booklet will be supplied to the applicant, showing all necessary details to be inserted in the immigration online application form.

3.Qualified applicants will be picked up at the airport as well.

employer: Hope in Action Youth Organization Project Limited
business: Access to health and education, agricultural training, promoting environmental conservation
description:
The scope of work for a trainee working as an intern under agriculture typically includes a variety of hands-on and observational tasks designed to provide practical experience in the field.  scope areas include:

1. Field Work and Crop Management
   - Assisting in planting, watering, fertilizing, and harvesting crops.
   - Monitoring crop health and identifying pest infestations or diseases.
   - Implementing pest control and crop protection measures.

2. Soil and Water Testing
   - Collecting soil and water samples for analysis.
   - Learning about soil fertility, nutrient management, and water conservation techniques.

3. Agricultural Practices and Techniques
   - Gaining knowledge of modern and traditional farming methods.
   - Participating in seed selection, crop rotation, and sustainable farming practices.

4. Use of Agricultural Machinery and Equipment
   - Operating and maintaining basic farm machinery under supervision.
   - Understanding the functioning of equipment like tractors, tillers, sprayers, etc.

5. Data Collection and Record Keeping
   - Recording data related to crop growth, weather conditions, and farm activities.
   - Assisting in preparing reports and documentation.

6. Research and Development Activities
   - Participating in experiments or pilot projects related to crop improvement, soil health, or pest management.
   - Learning about new agricultural technologies and innovations.

7. Extension and Outreach
   - Attending workshops, seminars, and training sessions.
   - Assisting in community outreach and educating farmers about best practices.

8. Environmental and Sustainability Practices
   - Understanding the importance of ecological balance, organic farming, and resource conservation.
   - Supporting initiatives to promote sustainable agriculture.

9. Administrative and Support Tasks
   - Assisting in procurement, inventory management, and other administrative duties.
   - Supporting project planning and implementation activities.

 on a specific agricultural sector or organization?
additional_Info: interview by the employer required
